lexUnit.name: ribbon.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a long, narrow strip of something.

sentence.text: The tide was rising : it came filtering gently in through the salt-marsh vegetation , washing up the beach and receding , leaving ribbons of foam along the sand .
His bare feet could identify all the frayed patches on the long ribbon of carpet and each worn tread on the stairs .
The ribbon of tarmac goes on to the lonely outpost of Leck Fell House , a speck of civilisation in a wide panorama that has no other sign of life .
Lift the knife to make a space beneath and slip in a ribbon of pepper .
Then seal all the edges with a ribbon of sealer to make them watertight .
A three-inch ribbon of snow , sideways up , is balanced on the telephone wires until , now and then , a bird lets on them , and ten or twenty yards fall like droppings into the street .
I came to jammed into the corner of the work room , squatting , fists clenched , staring up at a ribbon of orange light across the ceiling and a stack of timber beside me .
They emerged into the sharp , clean cold of the open air , and overhead hung a crumpled ribbon of stars .
The river too was uniformly dark apart from the ripples and eddies which were thin ribbons of light .
They came in to land in a snowscape , the lights along the thin ribbon of recently cleared runway coming into view and stretching out in front of them as the Seneca descended on its final approach .
Ronni blinked down at the glittering sea that was divided from the craggy landscape by a broad silken ribbon of glittering pale gold sand .
The road was a ribbon of moonlight over the purple moor .
When he was not writing or smoking , Bob noticed , he sat absolutely still , so still that the ribbon of smoke from his cigarette hung almost undisturbed for two or three feet above his hand .
A ribbon of fresh clear water meandering through beautiful unspoilt countryside , providing sport for the local anglers along its willow lined banks .
The pod appeared to be descending directly towards a winding ribbon of water .
He shook his head , settling back again in his chair , his eyes fixing on the silvery ribbon of water swirling away between the trees .
